definitions.definition: A heavy or helpless collapse; a slouching or drooping posture; a period of poor activity or performance, especially an extended period.
A measure of the fluidity of freshly mixed concrete, based on how much the concrete formed in a standard slump cone sags when the cone is removed.
The noise made by anything falling into a hole, or into a soft, miry place.
The gross amount; the mass; the lump.

definitions.example: Exhausted, he slumped down onto the sofa.

definitions.definition: To decline or fall off in activity or performance.
definitions.example: Real estate prices slumped during the recession.

definitions.definition: To lump; to throw together messily.
To fall or sink suddenly through or in, when walking on a surface, as on thawing snow or ice, a bog, etc.
(slang) To cause to collapse; to hit hard; to render unsconscious; to kill.
